TopicTitle: If I succeed in this, I will uninstall the game and never play again.

Articles.Content: Challenge Accepted

Whackjob, I've always looked at your amazing craft.

You aren't Harv in disguise or something, right?

Whackjob, I've always looked at your amazing craft.

You aren't Harv in disguise or something, right?

Who? Which Harv?

Has this died ?

I'm thinking of a number between "one" and "no".

First booster ring is almost complete. Should weigh in at 1,600 parts. Ouch.

I'm thinking of a number between "one" and "no"..

Is it 1.no?

Wow, 1600 parts.

Just wow.
Harvester, because you seem to like... know exactly how to build large monstors

I'm thinking of doing a design overhaul. Did a test launch, and it wound up precisely how you'd expect. Looked like the VAB took off.

But I'm not liking those engine clusters. I'm doing some alternate models to see what grabs me.

I'm thinking of doing a design overhaul. Did a test launch, and it wound up precisely how you'd expect. Looked like the VAB took off.

But I'm not liking those engine clusters. I'm doing some alternate models to see what grabs me.

I'm impressed enough that you got it into the air. Anything I build half that size tends to fall apart before the first stage.
Simply a marvel to see this come along, I am a massive fan of your "The harder this is to achieve the bigger the reward" mentality
meh! I hope we get more realistic drag, so that rockets have to be aerodynamic than just ridiculus. But good luck!

meh! I hope we get more realistic drag, so that rockets have to be aerodynamic than just ridiculus. But good luck!

It is not like only aerodinamical stuff can be launched, but it is cheaper/easier/more practical to do so.

meh! I hope we get more realistic drag, so that rockets have to be aerodynamic than just ridiculus. But good luck!

I remember reading somewhere about a cold-war-era concept for a rocket based on mass-produced small-diameter SRBs. They would be put together in a shape quite similar to Whackjobs "flying VAB" (awesome, btw), the only thing making them more aerodynamic was the pyramidal payload fairing on top.

I greatly look forward to the day that the aerodynamics model is made better. Even when that happens, I will still launch large things.

I will simply adjust my designs to account for it.

Looking forward to that day.

You must spread some Reputation around before giving it to Whackjob again.
Wackjob, you are truly awesome.

I'll tell you all one thing. When .22 comes, and subassemblies are a thing, you will see monsters of the like that even I dread to think what they will do to my machine!

The mental coal fire now has five tenders with large shovels.

I'll tell you all one thing. When .22 comes, and subassemblies are a thing, you will see monsters of the like that even I dread to think what they will do to my machine!

The mental coal fire now has five tenders with large shovels.

Bump. This thread must never die.
Almost up to first staging
Nice! That reminds me of one of those old time brick factories we have here in Pennsylvania.
Now, lift THAT entire thing into orbit with out using it's fuel

dude. you shouldn't delete your game. if you can do something like that, the ksp community wants you to do more inspiring things like this.

oh wait. you were joking weren't you?
WOW! I have never seen anything like these! I hope you do this from home and not from an institution!!! Freaking amazing!!

Almost up to first staging

Name that thing the Jackolantern.
Hrm. A good reminder that I do have a large project to finish. I will tend to it at tonight's de-officing.
What are your computer specs?????
